member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer
member.summary: Helper class to validate the correctness of instances. Useful in unit tests.

example.remarks: Where 'Instance' property returns a singleton instance of 'MyEventSource' class like: public static MyEventSource Instance = new MyEventSource();

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.ExcludeEventListenerEmulation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude the internal instance to emulate sending events.
member.remarks: The analyzer performs a 'probing' execution using an internal instance to emulate logging using the inspected instance. By excluding this analysis, no ETW events will be sent in case of executing the analysis from a running application where ETW events may be monitored.
member.value: true for excluding this analysis, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.ExcludeWriteEventTypeMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude an exact type mapping between the event arguments and 'EventSource.WriteEvent' argument.
member.value: true for excluding this analysis, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.ExcludeWriteEventTypeOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude the type order analysis between the event arguments and the 'EventSource.WriteEvent' arguments order. This process is costly and may be excluded for large event sources with events with many arguments. However it is recommended to leave this option off (default) to ensure that all 'EventSource.WriteEvent' arguments are correctly mapped to the event parameters.
member.value: true for excluding this analysis, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.InspectAll(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Inspects the specified for potential runtime errors.
member.param: The event source instance to inspect.

example.remarks: Where 'Instance' property returns a singleton instance of 'MyEventSource' class like: public static MyEventSource Instance = new MyEventSource();

member.exception: Exception thrown if a failure was found in the specified .
Exception thrown if a failure was found in the specified .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.SemanticLogging.Utility.EventSourceAnalyzer.Inspect(System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)
member.summary: Inspects the specified for potential runtime errors filtering out validations according to the specified instance properties.
member.param: The event source instance to inspect.

example.remarks: Where 'Instance' property returns a singleton instance of 'MyEventSource' class like: public static MyEventSource Instance = new MyEventSource();

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
